questions.question: What is the purpose of the `<template>` element in HTML?
options: It defines a reusable block of HTML that is not rendered until it is used by JavaScript.
It specifies metadata for the document.
It creates a table template.
It defines a section of content for printing.
questions.answer: It defines a reusable block of HTML that is not rendered until it is used by JavaScript.

questions.question: How does the `<slot>` element work in Web Components?
options: It defines a placeholder in a Web Component's shadow DOM for the content provided by the component's user.
It creates a named section for external JavaScript.
It sets the color of the Web Component's shadow DOM.
It styles the content of a Web Component.
questions.answer: It defines a placeholder in a Web Component's shadow DOM for the content provided by the component's user.

questions.question: What is the role of the `shadowRoot` in Web Components?
options: It encapsulates the internal DOM and styles of a Web Component, hiding them from the main document.
It specifies the size of the Web Component.
It manages the events within a Web Component.
It links the Web Component to external stylesheets.
questions.answer: It encapsulates the internal DOM and styles of a Web Component, hiding them from the main document.

questions.question: What does the `rel='noopener'` attribute do when used with `target='_blank'`?
options: It prevents the new page from being able to access the originating page's `window` object.
It opens the link in a new tab without referrer information.
It disables JavaScript in the new window.
It ensures that the link is opened in a private browsing session.
questions.answer: It prevents the new page from being able to access the originating page's `window` object.

questions.question: How do you define a custom element in HTML?
options: Using the `customElements.define` method in JavaScript.
Using the `<custom-element>` tag.
Defining the element within the `<script>` tag in HTML.
Using the `defineElement` method in HTML.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `fetch()` API in HTML5?
options: It is used to make network requests and handle responses asynchronously.
It retrieves metadata from the HTML document.
It updates the contents of a Web Component.
It fetches elements from the shadow DOM.
questions.answer: It is used to make network requests and handle responses asynchronously.

questions.question: How can you create a responsive iframe with HTML5?
options: By using CSS to set the width and height to 100% and using `aspect-ratio`.
By setting a fixed width and height in pixels.
By wrapping the iframe in a `<div>` with a specified size.
By using the `srcdoc` attribute to define the iframe's content.
questions.answer: By using CSS to set the width and height to 100% and using `aspect-ratio`.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `inputmode` attribute in HTML5?
options: It specifies the type of virtual keyboard to display on mobile devices.
It sets the maximum length of input in a text field.
It defines the input format for a form element.
It specifies the minimum and maximum values for numeric input.
questions.answer: It specifies the type of virtual keyboard to display on mobile devices.

questions.question: What does the `contenteditable` attribute do?
options: It specifies whether the content of an element is editable by the user.
It defines the content type of a form element.
It sets the default value for an input field.
It makes an element's content non-editable.
questions.answer: It specifies whether the content of an element is editable by the user.

questions.question: How do you use the `picture` element for responsive images?
options: By defining multiple `<source>` elements with different media queries inside a `<picture>` element.
By setting different image sources using the `srcset` attribute on the `` element.
By using the `sizes` attribute on the `` element.
By wrapping the `` element in a responsive container.
questions.answer: By defining multiple `<source>` elements with different media queries inside a `<picture>` element.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `FormData` object in HTML5?
options: To construct a set of key/value pairs representing form fields and their values.
To submit form data via AJAX requests.
To validate form inputs before submission.
To handle the formatting of form data for display.
questions.answer: To construct a set of key/value pairs representing form fields and their values.

questions.question: How do you specify the language of the document in HTML5?
options: By using the `lang` attribute in the `<html>` tag.
By setting the `language` attribute in the `<meta>` tag.
By using the `lang` attribute in the `<body>` tag.
By defining the `lang` property in JavaScript.
questions.answer: By using the `lang` attribute in the `<html>` tag.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `document.cookie` property?
options: To read and write cookies associated with the document.
To define the document's encoding settings.
To manipulate the document's layout.
To manage document-level JavaScript variables.
questions.answer: To read and write cookies associated with the document.

questions.question: How can you make a form field required in HTML5?
options: By adding the `required` attribute to the `<input>` element.
By setting the `mandatory` attribute on the `<form>` element.
By using the `validate` attribute on the `<input>` element.
By adding a `<required>` tag to the form field.
questions.answer: By adding the `required` attribute to the `<input>` element.

questions.question: What does the `hidden` attribute do in HTML?
options: It hides an element from view but keeps it in the document.
It removes an element from the document flow.
It prevents an element from being accessed by JavaScript.
It disables user interaction with the element.
questions.answer: It hides an element from view but keeps it in the document.

questions.question: How can you define a custom data attribute in HTML?
options: By using `data-*` attributes, such as `data-custom='value'`.
By setting a `custom-attribute` attribute on the element.
By defining attributes in the `data` tag.
By using the `customdata` attribute.
